event.title: mentioned in the Domesday Book in 1086

data.event: Aston was first mentioned in the Domesday Book in 1086 as "Estone", having a mill, a priest and therefore probably a church, woodland and ploughland.

The body of the church was rebuilt by J. A. Chatwin during the period 1879 to 1890; the 15th century tower and spire, which was partly rebuilt in 1776, being the only survivors of the medieval building.

event.title: was partly included in the borough of Birmingham in 1838

data.event: It was partly included in the borough of Birmingham in 1838, and a further part, Saltley was added in 1891.
It was partly included in the borough of Birmingham in 1838, and a further part, Saltley was added in 1891.
Gospel Hall on Park Lane was opened in 1892 and demolished in the 1970s to be rebuilt at the top of Park Lane in 1979.

The brewery was owned by the Midland Brewery Company was built around 1877.
